user_message:
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. - test_code: a modified iterate_post code that contains useful probe functions that print useful logs to a file "/tmp/logs/425.txt". The logs should contain the control path and state information of the violation scenario. If the MISRA C rule is not violated, you can just return an empty string for the test code. Here are the constraints for the test code: - DO NOT introduce new violations to demonstrate your scenario. - The test code MUST be compilable and executable. - The test code MUST include line breaks. - The test code MUST preserve the original logic of iterate_post as much as possible. - You MUST NOT define the main function. - You MUST NOT define macros. - The test code MUST not contain any mock functions. Here is the code of iterate_post: ```c static enum MHD_Result iterate_post (void *coninfo_cls, enum MHD_ValueKind kind, const char *key, const char *filename, const char *content_type, const char *transfer_encoding, const char *data, uint64_t off, size_t size) { struct connection_info_struct *con_info = coninfo_cls; (void) kind; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */ (void) filename; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */ (void) content_type; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */ (void) transfer_encoding; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */ (void) off; /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */ if (0 == strcmp (key, "name")) { if ((size > 0) && (size <= MAXNAMESIZE)) { char *answerstring; answerstring = malloc (MAXANSWERSIZE); if (! answerstring) return MHD_NO; snprintf (answerstring, MAXANSWERSIZE, GREETINGPAGE, data); con_info->answerstring = answerstring; } else con_info->answerstring = NULL; return MHD_NO; } return MHD_YES; } ``` Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function iterate_post: #define MAXNAMESIZE 20 ... #define MAXANSWERSIZE 512 ... #define GREETINGPAGE "

Welcome, %s!

" ... struct connection_info_struct { int connectiontype; char *answerstring; struct MHD_PostProcessor *postprocessor; } ... enum MHD_Result { /** * MHD result code for "NO". */ MHD_NO = 0, /** * MHD result code for "YES". */ MHD_YES = 1 } Judge whether the above iterate_post code violates the rule 2.1 or not.
scenario: The function iterate_post contains unreachable code when the condition (0 == strcmp(key, "name")) is true and the inner condition (size > 0 && size <= MAXNAMESIZE) is false. In that case, the else branch sets con_info->answerstring = NULL, and then the function returns MHD_NO immediately after the if-else construct. This means that any code after the if-else construct within the if block is unreachable because the return statement prevents further execution. However, this pattern is intentional and valid within the function's logic. No code after the return statement inside this block exists, so no truly unreachable code exists. Therefore, there is no violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 as there is no unreachable code in the function.
